instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: Macbook Air 820-00165-A Ornage light not turn on.
threads.message:
This unit was water damged and see damage around i625 and found the following measurment of i625.
Any help please.

p1=0v
p2=16
p3=4.2
p4=2.8v
p5=1
p6=0
p7=0.5
p8=1.5
p9=0
p10=3.4

p11=3.4
p12=3.4
p13=3.4
p14=3.4
p15=0
p16=8
p17=8
p18=8
p19=5
p20=5

p21=0.5
p22=0
p23=8.6
p24=8.6
p25=12.9
p26=15.1????
p27=2
p28=0v

threads.title: Macbook Air 820-00165-A Ornage light not turn on.
threads.message:
"p17=8
p18=8"
Post exact value; i.e. 8.22V, or 8.56V...

"p27=2
p28=0v"
Both R7021/22 bad.
Be sure no short to ground at pin 28, after changed them.

BTW,
"i625"
ISL6259...

threads.title: Macbook Air 820-00165-A Ornage light not turn on.
threads.message:
p17=8.61
p18=8.61
i couldnt find r7021/22 and now i found the value ( before i was wrong )
"p27=16.09
p28=16.09v

yes i625is ISL6259.

threads.title: Macbook Air 820-00165-A Ornage light not turn on.
threads.message:
R7121/22 in this case, but new values are good; forgot about the reistors.
Does it start in SMC bypass mode?
Trigger SMC_ONOFF_L and see if PM_PWRBTN_L drops to 0V at the same moment.

threads.title: Macbook Air 820-00165-A Ornage light not turn on.
threads.message:
Doesnt  start in SMC bypass mode.

Yes,Trigger SMC_ONOFF_L and   PM_PWRBTN_L drops to 0V at the same moment.

threads.title: Macbook Air 820-00165-A Ornage light not turn on.
threads.message:
Any pulse at PM_SLP_S4_l at same time?
Also check for pulses at big coils.

threads.title: Macbook Air 820-00165-A Ornage light not turn on.
threads.message:
dont have ocs, using true rms and  see, at PM_SLP_S4_l  .22 mv at same time
Also found different voltage  at big coils.

threads.title: Macbook Air 820-00165-A Ornage light not turn on.
threads.message:
Don't need special equipment.
Trigger SMC_ONOFF_L repeatedly and check if any voltage tries to appear at PM_SLP_S4_L signal.
You should get a reading of 1-2V at least, even 3V...

threads.title: Macbook Air 820-00165-A Ornage light not turn on.
threads.message: Trigger SMC_ONOFF_L repeatedly and check NO  voltage trips to appear at PM_SLP_S4_L signal, check couple of time.

threads.title: Macbook Air 820-00165-A Ornage light not turn on.
threads.message:
If PM_PWRBTN_L reacts, but NO PM_SLP_S4_L reaction at same time, then PCH issue.
Be sure first the PCH gets S5 and SUS voltages...

threads.title: Macbook Air 820-00165-A Ornage light not turn on.
Macbook Air 820-00165-A Ornage light not turn on.
threads.message:
"PPVOUT_S5_PCH_DCPSUSBYP_R, R0899=1.07v ????"
As per schematic, VOLTAGE=1.05V...

Put good flux and heat PCH.
You may have luck to be only crap under PCH.

threads.title: Macbook Air 820-00165-A Ornage light not turn on.
threads.message: put flux and heat pch, no luck ,thanks for helping me but i learn something today.
